Name: Isis suckling Horus
Description: This votive bronze is part of a number of statuettes dating from the Late Period and representing the goddess Isis who is suckling her son Horus. The wife of Osiris is dressed in a long tight-fitting dress. She wears a head-dress made from the skin of a vulture, a uraeus crown  and the horns of a cow surmounted by a solar disk. Isis holds the infant on her knees and presents her breast to him. Horus the child has a shaven head with the exception of the lock of childhood which falls to the left.
